name: Cloudlands : VR Minigolf
description: A VR minigolf experience taking you to a beautifully landscaped course high above the clouds. Single player, online and local multiplayer, and a course editor allow you to build, share, and play other user created holes. No swing or power meters here, simply swing the club to play. Fully supports HTC Vive and Oculus Touch.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7,8 or 10 (64bit) Processor: Intel Core i5-4590 equivalent or greater Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 /Radeon R9 290 equivalent or greater Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Very well execution, simple fun.

I don't like mini-golf games that have massively long and complicated holes, because it's not as much fun nor as impressive an achievment to get a 41 on a par 42 (yes, this game has a par 42) as it is to get a 2 on a par 3, yet both count the same on your scorecard.  That being said, this game is good enough to get my approval anyway. When the eventual additional courses and course editor come out I'll also be able to choose to play the kinds courses I prefer.

Relaxing and fun. Would love to see more 'out there' maps, like haunted houses or space themed or weird gravity to take advantage of the VRness.  Solid gameplay.  Con: Multiplayer is not really feasible. Holes can be short and swapping headsets every couple of minutes is a real pain, especially since people tend to have different head sizes and IPD. Would be better if it let you play all 9/18 holes and then swap to the next person.

Helpful Note: Only really need one controller for this game set one aside, And try to use the controller as if it were a putter.  The Game is fun and best suited for Party fun. The Achievements are quite unrealstic and need to be managed alittle bit better. Your power won't translate properly without a small backswing, and some of the courses can be the stuff that aggrovates people to no end and casue stress and frustration.  The Game design itself is very pretty and you can loose yourself into the enviroment.  I recommend this game to you if you like golf, don't mind abit of a challange or are looking for a good VR party game.
Very fun minigolf VR game! Worth the buy.

I have played about 5 VR games so far, and this is probably my favorite. However, it does have some bad bugs in it though that need to be fixed:  - When you swing to try to hit the ball hard, the putter sometimes swings right through the ball. Even worse, sometimes it records a stroke even though the ball didn't move. - Often you hit the ball out and instead of dropping the ball where you last hit it, it puts it at the location prior to that. - In my last game, the ball became lodged in a barrier. I lost 5 or 6 strokes on the last hole just to get it unstuck. What a great score I would have had. :(  Also, I wish there were more courses, but please no more like hole 11. I hate that one with a passion.
we play this game every night. the course designer is great fun. buy! i woukd pay for new dlc to build better holes.

Cloudlands minigolf is probably the VR minigolf game you want of all the versions out there. That does not mean the game doesn't have its shortcomings, oh no. The music is annoyingly repetitive, trying to hit the ball too hard seems to make your club pass through it, and while the magic of VR minigolf is that you can create the weirdest holes possible, some holes seemed to overdo it and felt hardly special instead.  Still, with good physics, great graphics, online multiplayer AND (future) Steam workshop integration for course creation, you will never run out of new and beautiful tracks to play on.
Great game. Fun for casually puttering around. Nice arrangement of difficult and easy courses like a real minigolf course.
The first time I've been so immersed I almost walked into a wall. The multiplayer makes this game a must-own!
Great game but dont purchase it for its multiplayer. Nobody plays multiplayer anymore :(
This is the VR Minigolf game you've been waiting for. We need more online users, join us!

This is one of my favorite VR titles. Voice chat works well, gameplay feels really good, and multiplayer is a really great experience.  This is a great game to show people VR.   That said there are two cons (That I expect will be solved in the future): Kind of small multiplayer lobbies (4 people max, but I'd love to see 6 or 8 instead) and Limited number of holes (Though with the amount of clever mechanics and 'tricks' used so far I have no doubts this number wont go up)    Also as soon as this game gets custom user made holes it'll be an even easier sell.

Fun game, I'm addicted. I finally cracked the top ten Global, so maybe I will take a break from the Cloudlands for a bit. But it's one of the few experiences that I can put on and squeeze in just a few minutes of fun in {or intense anger, it is golf after all}.
This game is pretty cool for a VR game. Its very basic but the courses are really fun. I don't recommend for people who are easily frustrated. Its hard and you need a lot of patience.
good game could do with more levels, the online is very emtpy though

Very fun for the content it has, but is over priced for the amount of content(number of courses) it has. The future ability to ceate courses should fix some of this...IF we are easily able to d/l the communities work.

Needs optimisation as it had some stuttering that i haven't had on any other vr game so far. Also actually getting the club to hit the ball requires some finesse as you can easily end up ghosting right through it. Also the physics are bugged, with the ball reliably bouncing backwards away off a gentle slope. Not the best vr game out there, needs work, but at its core it's still fun. the bugs just push it toward the edge of frustration. Still did all 18 holes. You'd be better served going to play it in real life. That said, i'm sure there'll be updates and fixes.

I'm good at actual minigolf, but this is just too hard. The holes just seem to be meant to be difficult and not fun. I can't even finish 9 holes because after just 2 or 3 I get frustrated and turn it off.

I didn't like the controls of this game at all. Also it makes you stand in a terrible spot when you try to recenter yourself to the ball and makes bad use of the playspace. The controls completely killed any enjoyment I got out of this game.

I really wanted to like this game, but just kept on getting tangled in my cables like no other game I've played in VR, which was very distracting, and made it hard for me to continue playing and enjoying it. If you have a larger room space to play in you might not have this issue, but with 1.5x2.5m, found it wasn't quite working well for me overall.
